title: In-situ S/TEM Investigations of Domain and Phase Transitions in Polarized Cu2Se
content: The superionic conductor Cu2Se [1-3] and Ag2Se [4] semiconductors are promising thermoelectric materials due to their low thermal conductivity that has their origin in the liquid-like character of the Cu- and Ag-ions. Among them, α-Cu2Se is a p-type semiconductor (the charge carriers being positively charged holes) with quite a small bandgap of≈0.84 eV. Under both thermal and electric fields, abnormal domain and phase transitions in both Cu2Se and Ag2Se semiconductors were investigated by in-situ transmission electron microscopy. We find that there is also a resistance change along with the domain transition. Atomically, the collective hopping of Cu+ ions triggered by electric fields or mechanical strains is the cause of the domain transition.
